{"title": "Discovery Kids: Kitten Corner", "title_search": "discovery kids kitten corner", "title_keyword": "discovery kids kitten corner", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/discovery-kids-kitten-corner/", "summary": "In Kitten Corner, kids can own and raise their very own kitten. {"title": "Cubis Gold", "title_search": "cubis gold", "title_keyword": "cubis gold", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/cubis-gold/", "summary": "Score BIG with a chain that sets off another chain and you have a CUBIS!  Cubis Gold is a simple, highly-charged arcade-puzzle game that goes beyond 2D point-and-click games; this game features a unique and engaging 3D board.   Move as quickly as you can while skillfully making chains of three or more cubes to remove them from the board before time runs out. {"title": "Titan Online", "title_search": "titan online", "title_keyword": "titan online", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/titan-online/", "summary": "An epic title based on traditional Asian culture, Titan Online is a fusion MMORPG that boasts a unique combination of martial arts and robots that takes place in a spectacular fantasy world.  Titan Online is based upon the Korean best-selling novel, \"Mo Siang.\" Set in ancient China, players will experience historic Chinese locales, meet influential figures from various dynasties, experience mysterious aspects of various ancient Asian cultures, all while trying to save the martial arts world by engaging in intense real-time battles.", "genre": ["MMORPG"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-04-28", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-110640-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-110640-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["EYA Interactive (Publisher)", "EYA Interactive (Developer)"], "platforms": ["PC"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Bonsai Barber", "title_search": "bonsai barber", "title_keyword": "bonsai barber", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/bonsai-barber/", "summary": "[WiiWare]  The village residents are hungry for the latest in foliage fashion, and it's up to you, the new barber, to fix them up. Use the tools of your trade: scissors, clippers, spray can, and more in this humorous, first-of-its-kind \"first-person-groomer\" game. Bonsai Barber features a colorful cast of 12 intriguing customers, including a temperamental shallot starlet (don't call her an onion), an oddball strawberry boffin, a cactus cowboy, a daredevil carrot, and a suave banana with top-secret clearance. Each day, five customers arrive to test your stylistic skill. If the customer requests a specific style, you'll plow that furrow, or you can rely on your expertise to pick from more than 30 popular fashions. Or, why not turn over a new leaf? Be creative and see how they react. They're a demanding bunch, so if you miss an appointment, you'll hear about it-on your Wii Message Board. If you do a good job, you may receive a gift or even a postcard from an exotic destination as your happy customers travel to distant lands and show off their exquisite coifs. [Nintendo]", "genre": ["Virtual Life"], "metascore": "75", "critic_reviews": 11, "user_score": "6.3", "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-03-30", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-110959-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-110958-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": "Generally favorable", "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["Europe", "North America", "Japan"], "companies": ["Nintendo (Publisher)", "Zoonami Ltd. {"title": "SlamIt Pinball: Big Score", "title_search": "slamit pinball big score", "title_keyword": "slamit pinball big score", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/slamit-pinball-big-score/", "summary": "Big Score is based around a classic story of police vs. criminals in a fight for a big score. The fantastic action will leave you breathless and will pump-up your adrenaline while you are rescuing your ball, trying to hit that last glowing target.\r Big Score can be played by four players, where you will be able to steal points and achievements from your playing partners.\r You will have to: risk a lot, airball a lot, save balls from jail, rush them across the bridge, break the safe code, play video modes, be precise and be quick if you plan to reach the final score.\r 12 modes and 8 mini-modes will guide you through the intense story where you will prepare, practice, steal, fight, chase, break-in, arrest, run and finally try to make your one chance for a Big Score.", "genre": ["Pinball"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": "5.5", "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-02-23", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-111570-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-111570-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Technetium Games (Developer)", "Kalypso (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["PC"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Asteroids 3K", "title_search": "asteroids 3k", "title_keyword": "asteroids 3k", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/asteroids-3k/", "summary": "Asteroids 3K is a simple but addicting pick up and play game.  The objective of Asteroids 3K is to score as many points by destroying asteroids and flying saucers while staying alive in your spaceship.   You can rotate left or right, thrust forward, fire forward, or use the hyperspace panic button to appear in a different random spot.  The number of asteroids increases in each level, up to a maximum of 12.  Each level has different colored asteroids, some harder to see than others.  Big saucers are slow and inaccurate.  Small saucers are more accurate in aiming at you.  You start out with 3 lives and can gain an extra life every 10,000 points.    Points awarded are: 20 points - Big asteroid 50 points - Medium asteroid 100 points - Small asteroid 500 points - Big flying saucer 1000 points - Small flying saucer  The highest score is recorded and saved automatically so you can try to beat your personal best.", "genre": ["Top-Down Shoot-'Em-Up"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-06-13", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-115680-17.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-115680-17.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Egerter Software (Developer)", "Egerter Software (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)"], "rating": null}

{"title": "Ultimate Party Challenge", "title_search": "ultimate party challenge", "title_keyword": "ultimate party challenge", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/ultimate-party-challenge/", "summary": "This innovative game pits players against their friends in fast-paced, over-the-top mini-game competitions and brain challenges. Ultimate Party Challenge also uses the functionality of the Wii Remote to test players' physical, musical, and mental skills. Customization plays an integral part of the game, allowing players to create their own avatars, upload their Mii, or choose from a diverse selection of amusing characters to set themselves apart and showcase their personality. Ultimate Party Challenge supports a variety of multiplayer modes where players can team up with up to three different players. Compete against each other in over 40 different mental and physical mini-games including Bungee Splash, 3-Row Basketball, Pinball and more. The more you win, the more you unlock fun customizations for your avatar.  Together with 3D backgrounds, intuitive gameplay and high-energy music makes Ultimate Party Challenge a unique gaming experience that's fun for the entire family. [Konami]", "genre": ["Party"], "metascore": 0, "critic_reviews": 0, "user_score": 0, "user_reviews": 0, "release_date": "2009-11-03", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-114066-13.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/3/6-1-114066-13.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": null, "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America"], "companies": ["Konami (Developer)", "Konami (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["Wii"], "rating": "E"}

{"title": "Blimp: The Flying Adventures", "title_search": "blimp the flying adventures", "title_keyword": "blimp the flying adventures", "url": "https://www.metacritic.com/game/blimp-the-flying-adventures/", "summary": "This unique "platformer" brings you 20 action-packed missions and the most stunning audio-visual experience on iPhone! Now with global leaderboard! Who'll be the best Blimp pilot?  REVIEWS ----------------------------------------- Although Crane Balls is comprised of only three people, they managed to conceive a beautiful world backed by pleasing hand-painted graphics, lots of impressive particle effects (like explosions, fire, etc.), a fluid framerate throughout and an original soundtrack spanning 11 amazing sounds. 8/10 IMPRESSIVE   - IGN.com  Blimp is one of the finest games currently available on the App Store. Through the originality of its gameplay and its beautiful presentation, Blimp should reside on the home screen of any discerning iGamer.  9/10 Superb   -  AppGamer.net  Blimp - The Flying Adventures is one of the best platformers in the App Store. If you’re even a remote fan of platformers you should give this unique title a try. Blimp - The Flying Adventures is straight out fun. 5/5 A MUST HAVE   -  AppAdvice.com  *************************************** The merchant planet Solbot of the Wondda galaxy was not always a merchant planet and a member of the Allied Planets organization. Not long ago it waged a bitter war with the malevolent aliens form the planet Tarra, who planned to seize this strategic outpost. As an allied pilot I, too, joined the fight only to come out of it as a captain Zed Pelin, a pilot of the merchant company on a new and independent planet. That could be the end of my story, but rather it's just a beginning...  FEATURES: * stunning graphics & artworks * high quality particle effects (fires, steams, explosions, radiations etc.) * 20 action packed levels * interesting story throughout the campaign * 5 completely different locations (dark forest, mines, snow mountains, red rocks...) * deceitful enemies incl. tanks, gun nests, blimps, bunkers * comic style briefs before each mission * created exclusively for iPhone/iPod  * extremely responsive controls * global score using OpenFeint  1.3 UPDATE FOR CASUAL PLAYERS SUBMITTED: In upcoming update you can turn off the time countdown and enjoy the beautiful hand-painted design.", "genre": ["Vertical Shoot-'Em-Up"], "metascore": "74", "critic_reviews": 5, "user_score": "6.0", "user_reviews": 5, "release_date": "2010-12-07", "images": ["https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-114239-52.jpg", "https://www.metacritic.com/a/img/catalog/provider/6/12/6-1-114239-52.jpg"], "video": null, "video_thumbnail": null, "video_type": null, "sentiment": "Mixed or average", "must_play": false, "crew": null, "countries": ["North America", "Europe"], "companies": ["Craneballs Studios (Developer)", "Craneballs Studios (Publisher)"], "platforms": ["iOS (iPhone/iPad)", "PSP"], "rating": "E"}
